intro: Eremurus persicus, commonly known as the Persian giant feathergrass, is a striking plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach heights of up to 3 meters. The plant produces large, feathery plumes of yellow-green flowers in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a landscape accent. Its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators make it a valuable addition to botanical collections.
